title: Anti-abortion center’s lawsuit against Mass. officials gets tossed
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge dismissed a 2024 lawsuit by Your Options Medical against Massachusetts state officials.
The lawsuit claimed the state's anti-crisis pregnancy center campaign violated constitutional rights but was not supported by evidence.
Massachusetts' campaign aims to inform consumers of crisis pregnancy center practices and promote trusted reproductive health providers.

title: Bruins, Marco Sturm must do their ‘homework’ to fix team’s top flaw for stretch run
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins focus on improving penalty kill performance, currently ranked 28th with a 76.4% success rate.
The team has a strong power play at 26.3%, ranking third in the NHL.
Coach Marco Sturm highlights excessive penalties as a key issue affecting team performance.

title: This Boston Marathon bombing survivor is running with Miles for Miracles
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Juliana Hermenegildo, a Boston Marathon bombing survivor, will run in the 2026 Boston Marathon with the Miles for Miracles team.
Hermenegildo is fundraising for Boston Children's Hospital, where her son Tiago had successful open-heart surgery at 17 months old.
Inspired by her son's experience, she is running to honor him and support BCH, seeking healing from past trauma.

title: Teaming up with Al Horford against Celtics will be ‘weird,’ Kristaps Porzingis says
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kristaps Porzingis and Al Horford, former Celtics, now play for the Golden State Warriors after offseason and trade moves.
Porzingis describes facing the Celtics with Horford as 'weird' after being sidelined for a month due to health issues.
Al Horford appreciates his Boston connections, expressing excitement for reuniting with former teammates and coaches.

title: Celtics reportedly bring back Dalano Banton on 10-day contract
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Boston Celtics signed Dalano Banton to a 10-day contract after he completed a 10-day stint with the Clippers.
Banton, who played with the Celtics in 2024, averaged 16.7 points during his last 30 games with the Blazers that season.
John Tonje was also signed to a 10-day contract after being acquired from the Jazz in exchange for Chris Boucher.

title: Here’s why Ed Markey is boycotting the State of the Union — and what he and others are doing instead
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Sen. Ed Markey will boycott President Trump's State of the Union to attend 'People’s State of the Union' rally.
The rally, organized by MoveOn and MeidasTouch, will feature Democratic lawmakers and those impacted by Trump policies.
Rep. Seth Moulton will attend Trump's speech, bringing a young immigrant as his guest to highlight immigration issues.

title: South Boston St. Patrick’s Parade to follow new route for 250th Evacuation Day
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The South Boston St. Patrick's Parade will follow a new route starting at Andrew Square on March 15.
The route change commemorates the 250th anniversary of Evacuation Day and Henry Knox's historic march.
The parade will have a family-friendly zone at Medal of Honor Park and aims to manage larger crowds.

title: New England has the best open-air and maritime museums in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Plimoth Patuxet Museums in Plymouth named top open-air museum in USA Today's 2026 Readers' Choice Awards.
Maine Maritime Museum in Bath ranked as the best maritime museum, highlighting New England's nautical history.
Old Sturbridge Village and Concord Museum also recognized, enhancing Massachusetts' cultural and historical tourism profile.

title: Second worker exposed to gas at Maine pulp mill dies
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Allen Hornberger, 26, died nearly three weeks after toxic gas exposure at Woodland Pulp Mill in Baileyville, Maine.
Hornberger, from North Collins, NY, was a process engineer and died due to injuries from a January 27th incident.
A fatal gas exposure killed intern Kasie Malcolm the day after the incident at the mill's bleach plant.

title: Warriors’ Stephen Curry to miss Thursday’s game against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stephen Curry will miss the Warriors' game against the Celtics due to ongoing knee pain and swelling.
Curry has been sidelined since January 30, missing 16 games this season with runner’s knee.
New Warrior Kristaps Porzingis is set to debut against Boston, as the team seeks a boost without Curry.
